participants package¶

Submodules¶

participants.fitResults module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
participants.fitResults.plotExpectations(partName, fitQuality, partActions, modExpect, reward)[source]¶

The success of accurately providing the participants action as the most likely

Parameters:
  • partName (string) – The name label for the participant
  • fitQuality (float) – A description of the quality of a fit
  • partActions (array of floats) – The actions for each timestep
  • modExpect (2D array of floats) – The action reward expectations for each model. Each row represents one model.
  • reward (1D array of floats shaped as a 2D array like modExpect) – The reward received by the participants at each point
Returns:

fig
Return type:

matplotlib figure object
participants.fitResults.plotFitting(participant, modelData, fitQuality)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • participant (dict) – The data for the participant
  • modelData (dict) – The data for the model instance
  • fitQuality (float) – A description of the quality of a fit
Returns:

figSets – The figures associated with the fitting of the participant
Return type:

list of matplotlib figure objects
participants.fitResults.plotFittingSuccess(partName, fitQuality, partActions, modActProb)[source]¶

The success of accurately providing the participants action as the most likely

Parameters:
  • partName (string) – The name label for the participant
  • fitQuality (float) – A description of the quality of a fit
  • partActions (array of floats) – The actions for each timestep
  • modActProb (2D array of floats) – The action probabilities for each model. Each row represents one model.
Returns:

fig
Return type:

matplotlib figure object
participants.fitResults.plotRewards(partName, fitQuality, partActions, reward)[source]¶

The participant action and rewards

Parameters:
  • partName (string) – The name label for the participant
  • fitQuality (float) – A description of the quality of a fit
  • partActions (array of floats) – The actions for each timestep
  • reward (1D array of floats shaped as a 2D array like modExpect) – The reward received by the participants at each point
Returns:

fig
Return type:

matplotlib figure object
